byline.original: By PETER LATTMAN and NADIA SUSSMAN

abstract: Raj Rajaratnam, the former chief of the Galleon Group, was sentenced to 11 years in prison, a punishment that exceeds any other given for insider trading.
snippet: Raj Rajaratnam, the former chief of the Galleon Group, was sentenced to 11 years in prison, a punishment that exceeds any other given for insider trading.
lead_paragraph: Raj Rajaratnam, the former chief of the Galleon Group, was sentenced to 11 years in prison, a punishment that exceeds any other given for insider trading.

headline.main: Sentence Is Longest Ever for Insider Trading
